citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
There is a glass jar on the counter in the kennel that contains an opaque, light-yellow liquid. There is no labeling on the
jar. The licensee states it is a mixture of 30 tablets of 500mg Metronidazole, 120 ml of Albon, and 120 ml of Safegard and
it was approved for use by the Attending Veterinarian. The APHIS official spoke with the Attending Veterinarian to confirm
that statement. Unlabeled medications can be problematic if the contents are unknown, expired, or if the dose of the
concoction is unknown. Correct by ensuring that all medications are properly labeled and not expired, so the licensee is
able to use the appropriate methods to prevent, control, diagnose, and treat diseases. Correct by: September 27, 2023.

There are two enclosures housing a total of 5 dogs that have barbed wire along the top of the chain link paneling to
discourage dogs climbing the walls. Barbed wire can be dangerous as it can cause wounds or other injury to the dogs if
they come into contact with the sharp points of the wires. Correct by ensuring the housing facilities are free from jagged
edges or sharp points that might inure the animals. Correct by: September 27, 2023.

There are no records of vaccinations for adult dogs retained by the facility. The facility reports a 7 way vaccine (including
distemper and parvovirus) was given to all adult dogs at the beginning of 2023 but there is no written record kept. Per the
Attending Veterinarian this information is correct. Written records of vaccinations help determine the vaccination status
and vaccination due dates of all individuals at the facility. Correct by creating and maintaining a written document of the
names of all vaccines administered and the dates of administration for each dog, or by creating and maintaining a kennel
record. Correct by: September 27, 2023

There are no records of heartworm testing or fecal testing retained by the facility. The APHIS official spoke with the
Attending Veterinarian to confirm that testing had been done. Maintaining complete medical records for animals housed at
the facility ensures that individuals are getting the care needed for preventable diseases and for evaluating the
effectiveness of a parasite control program. Correct by retaining documentation and results of all diagnostic testing done
for animals of the facility. Correct by: October 1, 2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
2.40(b)(2) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
There is a glass jar on the counter in the kennel that contains an opaque, light-yellow liquid. There is no labeling on the 
jar. The licensee states it is a mixture of 30 tablets of 500mg Metronidazole, 120 ml of Albon, and 120 ml of Safegard and 
it was approved for use by the Attending Veterinarian. The APHIS official spoke with the Attending Veterinarian to confirm 
that statement. Unlabeled medications can be problematic if the contents are unknown, expired, or if the dose of the 
concoction is unknown. Correct by ensuring that all medications are properly labeled and not expired, so the licensee is 
able to use the appropriate methods to prevent, control, diagnose, and treat diseases. Correct by: September 27, 2023. 
3.1(c)(1)(ii) 
   
Housing facilities, general. 
There are two enclosures housing a total of 5 dogs that have barbed wire along the top of the chain link paneling to 
discourage dogs climbing the walls. Barbed wire can be dangerous as it can cause wounds or other injury to the dogs if 
they come into contact with the sharp points of the wires. Correct by ensuring the housing facilities are free from jagged 
edges or sharp points that might inure the animals. Correct by: September 27, 2023. 
3.13(b)(3) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
There are no records of vaccinations for adult dogs retained by the facility. The facility reports a 7 way vaccine (including 
distemper and parvovirus) was given to all adult dogs at the beginning of 2023 but there is no written record kept. Per the 
Attending Veterinarian this information is correct. Written records of vaccinations help determine the vaccination status 
and vaccination due dates of all individuals at the facility. Correct by creating and maintaining a written document of the 
names of all vaccines administered and the dates of administration for each dog, or by creating and maintaining a kennel 
record. Correct by: September 27, 2023 
3.13(b)(4) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
There are no records of heartworm testing or fecal testing retained by the facility. The APHIS official spoke with the 
Attending Veterinarian to confirm that testing had been done. Maintaining complete medical records for animals housed at

the facility ensures that individuals are getting the care needed for preventable diseases and for evaluating the 
effectiveness of a parasite control program. Correct by retaining documentation and results of all diagnostic testing done 
for animals of the facility. Correct by: October 1, 2023. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee. 
 
 n
